Title: Object: Ancient Musical Instruments.
Description: An image at centre depicting three women playing musical instruments, after an ancient sculptural group in the Ghigi Palace in Rome; a half-bust man underneath playing the trumpet, taken from the Arch of Titus and the Trajan's Pillar; a Cupid at top playing a flute, after an antique painting at the Museum of Portici; five images around, depicting figures from Egyptian paintings; an explanatory key below image; illustration to 'A general history of Music' by Charles Burney, plate III. 1804 Engraving
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Dr Charles Burney (Estate of)
Acquisition notes: Described in the inventory of Burney's collection (CD.4.18) under I.
